title: Gee Riot, I Wonder How This Game Turned Out
body:
For the first time in forever, I was able to get the system to create a game in MY favor instead and actually match me with people IN MY ELO.

But too bad that wasnt the case for the enemy team though.

But as you all know, Silver 1-2 is the same as Gold 4 right? Right?!

replies.body:
that difference in skill is so miniscule
if you let that affect your gameplay no wonder you lost

> [{quoted}](name=PrismalDawn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qAm42AQG,comment-id=,timestamp=2019-04-09T08:11:20.491+0000)
>
> But as you all know, Silver 1-2 is the same as Gold 4 right?

Yes. Silver 1 and Gold 4 are virtually the same.
Are we forgetting that Gold 5 doesn't exist anymore?

That isn't even all there is to it:

- Kennen and Rengar were premades; Both Gold last season

- Twitch and Lulu were premades

- Kayle is Gold 4, 0 LP, 50% win rate.

- No one on your team was premade

As far as "match fairness" is concerned, both teams had approximately the same chance of winning.
The only odd ball there is Talon: Silver 2, 48% winrate, peak Silver. That said, he had the best performance in the enemy team.
Silver 1-2 is only a couple divisions away from Gold 4. It's not a huge difference, especially given that matchmaking is based on matchmaking rating and not tier/division.
A silver player might have the same mechanics as a gold player, but the Gold player will better manage an advantage and out-rotate the silver once the laning phase is over.

> [{quoted}](name=PrismalDawn,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=qAm42AQG,comment-id=00000000,timestamp=2019-04-09T08:19:09.963+0000)
>
> A silver player might have the same mechanics as a gold player, but the Gold player will better manage an advantage and out-rotate the silver once the laning phase is over.

Implying a Gold player is "so much better" than a Silver player. That really isn't the case. mid/high Silver (Silver 3, 2, 1) and low/mid Gold (Gold 4, 3, 2) are virtually the same thing.

>
> A silver player might have the same mechanics as a gold player, but the Gold player will better manage an advantage and out-rotate the silver once the laning phase is over.

not true there are plenty of golds and platinum players that still have terrible mechanics due to being carried by a smurf or a experienced player that doesn't belong in the elo. 1 to 2 (perhaps even 3) could get carried be sheer luck.

we also can't forget that there are people that buy boosted accounts just to feed in a higher division 
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}

plat players are just as bad as silver players sometimes and i say this as a hardstuck mid plat player

so no that isnt a huge difference in elo
